intro: Mediocalcar crenulatum, commonly known as the wavy-leaved sandwort, is a small, flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is shallow and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in well-drained soils. Mediocalcar crenulatum is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation.
